content.div:
Rihanna is reportedly continuing to confuse her friends, women's groups, children and humanity in general by supporting her abuser Chris Brown in his latest attempt to make a mockery of common decency.

RadarOnline is reporting RiRi is backing up her "Birthday Cake" remix collaborator's claims that he didn't steal a fan's cell phone.

"Chris told Rihanna that he absolutely 1000% didn't steal that phone, and Rihanna has told him she believes him. Rihanna has also told Chris that she will stand by him during the investigation, and whatever the future holds," an insider tells the website. "This was extremely humbling to Chris given their tumultuous past, and he told her how much he appreciated her unwavering support to him, despite the criticism she has endured for recording songs with Chris and welcoming him back into her life."

An act that would be sweet if CB wasn't reportedly using "I promise I won't beat you" as a pick up line.

"Chris wouldn't need to be convicted in the Miami case to cause problems with his probation, just charged," the litigiously conscious source continued. "The conditions of his felony probation are very, very strict. Chris must obey all laws and not be arrested for any other crimes. This could be a huge nightmare for his probation if he is arrested and charged."

The insider also explained how Rihanna maintains her dumbfounding captaincy on Team Breezy: she employs the time-tested practice made popular by 2-year-olds of sticking one's fingers in one's ears and saying "nananana."

"[Rihanna] has made it very clear to everyone around her that she doesn't want to hear anything negative about Chris," the source says. "She isn't interested in listening to the fears her friends have about the two young singers spending time together."

jond@dose.ca

link.Abstract: According to a police report, Chris Brown called a fan a b*tch before stealing her iPhone outside of a Miami club.

link.Abstract: After Spann took a photo, Brown reached through the window of his Bentley and took her iPhone from her hands, saying, "B----, you ain't going to put that on no website” before rolling out, according to reports.
link.title: After Spann took a photo, Brown reached through the window of his Bentley and took her iPhone from her hands, saying, "B----, you ain't going to put that on no website” before rolling out, according to reports.

link.Abstract: Chris Brown has been hurling insults at WWE champion CM Punk since the wrestler Tweeted about the pop star earlier this week. Punk has since posted a video challenging Brown to a fight, with the benefits going to a women's shelter.
link.title: WWE Wrestler Challenges Chris Brown to a Match

link.Abstract: The admitted woman-beater hit on an employee of Lasio Professional Hair Care's Grammy gift lounge using one of the most disturbing pick-up lines ever.
link.title: Chris Brown Reportedly Uses "I Promise I Won't Beat You" As Pick-Up Line; World Collectively Gags

link.Abstract: A pile of famous folks took to Twitter to voice their disgust with the Grammys' Chris Brown love-fest, and Brown responded by telling them to "f*ck off."
link.title: Update: Unapologetic Chris Brown Tells Haters to 'F*ck Off'

link.Abstract: Chris Brown lost a request to reduce his five-year probataion sentence. Still, expect to see the pop star at the Grammy Awards Sunday, playing the same stage as Rihanna.
link.title: Chris Brown Loses Plea To Reduce Probation (He's Still Playing the Grammys, Though)

link.Abstract: Despite hookup rumours, Rihanna and Chris Brown reportedly kept their distance at an L.A. hotspot earlier this week.
link.title: Rihanna and Chris Brown Ignore Each Other at L.A. Nightclub

link.Abstract: According to Us Weekly, Rihanna and Chris Brown have been secretly hooking up for nearly a year.
link.title: Are Rihanna and Chris Brown Hooking Up...Again?
